definition: to harmonize/to reconcile/to blend/to suit well/to adjust/to regulate/to season (food)/to provoke/to incite
to transfer/to move (troops or cadres)/to investigate/to enquire into/accent/view/argument/key (in music)/mode (music)/tune/tone/melody
to push aside with the hand, foot, a stick etc/to dial/to allocate/to set aside (money)/to poke (the fire)/to pluck (a string instrument)/to turn round/classifier: group, batch

sentences.english: Famine here is very serious. The government has already given out relieving grain to this area.
sentences.chinese: 此地粮荒严重，政府已经在调拨救济粮了。

sentences.english: The state allotted them large quantities of chemical fertilizer.
sentences.chinese: 国家给他们调拨了大量化肥。

sentences.english: Improve and increase the financial and human resources allocated to mental health.
sentences.chinese: 改善和增加调拨财力和人力资源用于精神卫生。

sentences.english: Many years responsible for the co un try transportation allocation cattle sheep business.
sentences.chinese: 长年负责向全国各地输送调拨肉牛肉羊业务。

sentences.english: The Internal-Transfer requisition must be submitted to the Executive Chef (or in His absence the Executive Sous Chef) for approval.
sentences.chinese: 所有果汁和蔬菜汁内部调拨单必须交由行政总厨同意。

definition: to assign (a task to different people)/to allocate
land tax/money and grain (given as tax or tribute)
